unnormalised: IIT Delhi announced a new course on AI ethics. The course, starting 01/08/2024, aims to bridge the gap between AI development and societal impact. Prof. Meena Sharma, head of the Computer Science dept., stated, "AI's rapid growth necessitates a strong ethical framework. This course will equip students with the skills to build responsible AI systems."
normalised: I-I-T Delhi announced a new course on A-I ethics. The course, starting first august two thousand and twenty four, aims to bridge the gap between A-I development and societal impact. Professor Meena Sharma, head of the Computer Science department, stated, "A-I's rapid growth necessitates a strong ethical framework. This course will equip students with the skills to build responsible A-I systems."

unnormalised: The curriculum will cover topics like algorithmic bias, data privacy, and the impact of AI on employment. Experts from TCS and Infosys will also conduct guest lectures. Students will get hands-on experience with case studies and real-world scenarios, addressing issues such as bias in facial recognition software and the ethical implications of AI-powered surveillance.
normalised: The curriculum will cover topics like algorithmic bias, data privacy, and the impact of A-I on employment. Experts from T-C-S and Infosys will also conduct guest lectures. Students will get hands-on experience with case studies and real-world scenarios, addressing issues such as bias in facial recognition software and the ethical implications of A-I-powered surveillance.

unnormalised: Enrollment is open to all students with a background in CS or related fields. The course carries 3 credits and will be conducted over 1 semester. It's designed to be accessible to both undergraduate and postgraduate students. Registration closes on 15/07/2024.
normalised: Enrollment is open to all students with a background in C-S or related fields. The course carries three credits and will be conducted over one semester. It's designed to be accessible to both undergraduate and postgraduate students. Registration closes on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: AI is transforming industries worldwide, and this course reflects the growing awareness of its potential risks. Understanding AI ethics is not just about following rules, it's about developing a sense of responsibility. The course is expected to enhance the employability of graduates and foster a culture of ethical AI innovation in India.
normalised: A-I is transforming industries worldwide, and this course reflects the growing awareness of its potential risks. Understanding A-I ethics is not just about following rules, it's about developing a sense of responsibility. The course is expected to enhance the employability of graduates and foster a culture of ethical A-I innovation in India.
